A video has been shared as a “miracle” depicting rain falling only on Nataraja Temple in Tamil Nadu while surrounding areas remain dry. The tweet by @LostTemple7 drew over 1 lakh views and 13,000 likes.
Thillai Nataraja Temple, Chidambaram
Hindu temple in Chidambaram, Tamil Nadu 💓🌺
— Lost Temples™ (@LostTemple7) November 22, 2020
The video was also shared by Twitter handle @BharatTemples_.
Thillai Nataraja Temple, Chidambaram, TamilNadu
Observe, Rain shower only on Lord Nataraja pic.twitter.com/IFCLLsOzu3
— Bharat Temples (@BharatTemples_) November 19, 2020
It has also been shared on Facebook and promoted by the website Tamil Thisai.
This slideshow requires JavaScript.

In the video, it seems as if it’s pouring only on the statue of Hindu deity Nataraja because the temple is lighted. As one may have frequently observed, raindrops are visible under street lights when it’s dark outside. This is, in fact, a common method used to confirm whether it’s raining or not when the downpour is not heavy. Apart from this, the sound of rain can also be heard the clip.
The raindrops are better visible when the video is slowed down.

We also found a video uploaded on November 19, 2020, about the same incident — rain at Thillai Nataraja temple of Chidambaram. After 1:45 minutes in the video, the rain can also be seen pouring on the temple courtyard. The courtyard is completely wet and the sound of falling water can also be heard.
Facebook page ‘Thiruvallur News’ also posted a video of rain pouring on the temple’s courtyard to debunk viral claims that the rainfall was concentrated on Nataraja’s statue.

Posted by Thiruvallur News on Thursday, 19 November 2020
Raindrops visible only under lights in the dark is a common phenomenon.

The video portrayed as a “miracle” unsurprisingly has a logical explanation. While the camera might have tricked the eye, common sense should suggest that the rain could not have poured only on the statue.
